intro: Rudbeckia laciniata var. gaspereauensis, commonly known as the Gaspé rudbeckia, is a striking perennial plant native to eastern Canada and parts of the northeastern United States. It features large, showy yellow flowers with dark centers, typically blooming from late summer into early fall. The plant has lance-shaped, deeply lobed leaves that are green and slightly hairy on the underside. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
